website_summaries.verdict: An accordion-style gate that provides a good value by fitting nicely across wide openings.
pros: When not in use, this gate can compress completely back against the wall
Less intrusive than some other gates because of its ability to compress
Contains dogs away from babies, or to certain areas effectively
A good gate to also use on a deck opening
cons: Very functional, but not as sturdy as other gates on the market
Must be screwed into the wall

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect and made my dog happy
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. it's light, and SO easy to install. It's not too flimsy and now my dog can freely enjoy being in the front yard. My home has a fenced yard but the walkway is open and there is no gate. I'm a renter and this was an easy solution since I can't buy a real gate for the house and when the dog comes in, I can easily unhook and carry the gate inside with me. As a bonus... this was also a great solution to stop the neighbors dog from coming over in the middle of the night and doing his business on my lawn every night.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Annette Photography

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value for Money! Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This was the easiest gate to attach to our wall and it works flawlessly. When not in use it sits flat against the wall. A friend of mine purchased one after I did and spray painted it white so it blended in to his walls. I use the full 60" width and it works great as a barrier for my dog. I wouldn't recommend this if you're wanting to protect a child from going up and down stairs. It does offer protection but not enough for me to trust it for that purpose. As for blocking off a room, this is perfect. I've attached pictures for reference.
customer_reviews.author: OtisPaul

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly! Works great
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install. I did it in about 10 minutes with no tools. I did have to use my own anchor though on one side of the wall that was drywall. Still easy. Opens easy and is mostly sturdy. Sturdy enough to deter my dogs from going to that part of the hall.
customer_reviews.author: Lira D.

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and Easily Broken
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these when we got puppies because the version we owned 25 years ago was quite good. This gate is designed so that it can open from either side. This is also its downfall because the connections to the eye hooks are not very secure. All too often when one side was released the other side would also slip out of its eye hooks. Ultimately, one of the two gates broke.
customer_reviews.author: M. Younger

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I had this gate for 6 days. I had taken the gate out of the doorway and moved it into the hallway, propped it up against the wall so that I could let my kittens out of the room (I didn't want to install the screws into my door frame so I just had been expending the gate out and it worked well). The gate fell over in the hallway and a big chuck of the wood broke off. I am going to try and gorilla glue it back on, but very disappointed as I paid $30 for this gate.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal A.

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought 4 of these for various room dividers over the years . The most recent one broke within 2 days from a 20 pound little dog leaning on it. When the wood snapped, it caught the dogs ear in the plastic top rail and that’s where the blood drops in the pic came from. The first 2 where great, idk if they re-did the design or what but I won’t buy another one again.
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sturdy, Easy Installation
customer_reviews.text: This gate is just what we needed. I was hoping for a gate with a door to use at our wide living room opening but they are a lot more costly. I settled with this one but was pleasantly surprised. It is quite easy to use and does its job, keeping the baby confined. My only worry is how it will hold up with my 3 year old boy, who can be rough, but for the price it's worth the gamble. Installation was really easy too. Just don't be my husband and assume that the door frame is wood. The short screws fell out the next day. Opps!
customer_reviews.author: MamaLisa123

customer_reviews.title: constantly breaking the stops
customer_reviews.text: each section has a stop so you can overextend it. great idea in theory if the stops werent so flimsy. after the first time they snapped, i was more careful - and i still snapped them. so, i bought "used", but "like new" and guess what - the first thing i did was check the stops - some were broken or cracked already. clearly i am not the only one and i dont think they are all purchased by body builders. if the stops werent so chintzy it could be a decent gate.
customer_reviews.author: massma

customer_reviews.title: Works well even when not installing it. Length is great!
customer_reviews.text: Looked at every gate on Amazon and settled on this one, and I'm happy with it. Quality seems good, and we haven't had any issues. Bought this to block our kitten's access to the door when we arrive home, so she doesn't run out. I can't speak for the installation, because we just prop it up and put it away when home. This won't block the kitten completely. She has already shown that. But it slows her down, which is all I need. Not a fan of the plastic cover over the top. It's an unflattering off-white color that I can't imagine fitting in with anyone's decor - which is a shame, because the wood looks really nice.
customer_reviews.author: amazondre

customer_reviews.title: Best doorway access
customer_reviews.text: This was the best option for our use in our doorways to block access for our large dogs. We loved that we didn’t have to step over anything & had the full width of the doorway to use, unlike pressure-mount gates which narrow the opening considerably. We did not use them on the staircase & would not recommend that because the bottom doesn’t have a horizontal brace. Very easy to install. A couple insights for consideration: install it a smidge higher so you can place felt on the bottom if using over a hard floor surface; install beyond trimwork & far enough out from wall/trim to avoid marking them up (1 less turn of the screws).
customer_reviews.author: CKinMI

customer_reviews.title: Good gate, but comes unhinged sometimes
customer_reviews.text: Got this gate for our basement to keep the dog out of the "junk" side of the basement. It is installed in the doorway. Hubby said it was easy to do. It's easy to open/close one-handed by holding the top bar. However, because of how it's installed, the "open hooks" go into the eyehooks on the door frame, and sometimes if you're not careful when you open/close it, those "open hooks" come out of the eyehooks, then basically the door falls off its hinges (so to speak). Perhaps if there was a clip style hook that went into the eyehook, that would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn MAC

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gate a couple years ago when my middle child was one. Now my daughter who is one needed a gate to keep her safe, and I immediately wanted this same one so I bought another one. Installation is super easy. The gate expands a good bit covering big areas, much larger than your typical gates. Being at the top of stairs is dangerous, babies can easily shake it and have the latches break causing them to fall so I would not recommend that. If you are needing a gate that can expand wide areas and is easy on and off I would absolutely recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl T.

customer_reviews.title: great for pets
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these and they are awesome. They keep my dogs out of rooms I don't want them to have access to. My dog is a pretty big boy and he hasn't been able to break it yet by just leaning or rearing up on it. So, I'd say they are pretty sturdy. The only small complaint I have is that the install is a little tricky if you aren't careful to make sure each side is EXACTLY the same height. I was off by about 1/2" on one side and the side that was higher than the other was nearly impossible to latch...totally my fault, but easy to screw up.
customer_reviews.author: GunNut37086

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well-designed
customer_reviews.text: This is so great, I immediately bought a second one. I have one on my porch to keep my dogs in, and a second at the back door stoop. Installation takes minutes. So much better then the swing door style that requires a cleared area to swing out, this collapses easily into itself. I live in Florida and we have our rainy season coming, so I’ll see how it withstands the damp. But even if I only get one year out of it, it’s worth it. It is very well built with thoughtful “engineering” with minimal plastic - actually quite attractive as gates go. Absolutely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: LJezard

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gate used years ago and it lasted through so much, that when I saw these gates still being sold I had to get 2 more. They are easy to use, and install so much easier than my pressure mounted gate. I would say to be certain small body parts are kept clear of the gate when opening it though. This gate stood through 3 large breed dogs, and numerous kids slamming into it. They also are perfect for if you want to mount hooks in more than one place so you can move your gate to which ever room you are needing it to be in!
customer_reviews.author: April Mansfield

customer_reviews.title: After easy installation, it opens and closes quickly & securely!
customer_reviews.text: We had rescued a 3 tear old miniature Dachshund. This guy loves to run, he slips out a door faster then you can breathe! I mounted this gate across the 4' by 4' space before door & opposite coat closet creating a controlled space so as to open the front door without the little red 4 legged torpedo flying out and running out of control all over the neighborhood.Oh did I mention GREAT PRICE & EASY SECURE INSTALL!!! We Bought a 2nd one for the back door! Same GREAT PRICE & EASY SECURE INSTALL!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tony.M

customer_reviews.title: It did the job for a little bit.
customer_reviews.text: Once my child was 20 months he was able to climb the gate. He has older siblings tho so it might work longer for an only child. I found the design to work well for about half a year but then collapsing (opening or making the gate smaller to walk through) became almost impossible. It derailed and I had to figure out how to get it back on track (you have to wreck it to fix it. Lol). It happened quite regularly after the first time and I think it could have been designed better. If you need something for a few months tho, this will do.
customer_reviews.author: Sami Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Two gates: top and bottom of stairs. Great fit!
customer_reviews.text: Grandchildren visiting our home for a week, 11 month old will be going everywhere. For preparation, bought 2 of these gates and 2 of the white Velcro mounting boards from another Amazon listing. Received them in couple of days from Amazon! Wow! Liked that the swing gate came with 4 x 2" and 4 x 1" eye screws. Short ones went into the Verco mounting board (attached to wood stair baluster) and long eyebolts into the sheetrock wall, into stud. Wife likes that either side of gate can be opened. 3 yr old figured how to open, so need to teach her how to properly close it. 11 month old is safe from crawling to bottom, and top of stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not the worst but...
customer_reviews.text: Ive had several several babygates. this one isnt bad, our biggest issue was using the hooks screwed into the wall isnt the best idea at all unless you're screwing it into a wall stud, but even then if your toddler likes to push against it or runs into it or what have you it can easily dislodge the hooks. Especially if just into dry wall...a longer screw hook wont make a big difference and you'll end up with it pulling right out with a hole. Much less to have it on both sides holding it up. Not the worst, but can cause issues if you are not ready for that
customer_reviews.author: Alitos

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for MY needs
customer_reviews.text: This is PERFECT for my needs, which is keeping beasties corralled at times. No bottom frame, so no tripping hazard. I needed a gate that was both retractable AND swings to rest flat against the wall. This is it. It is nice enough looking for the price, although I would have paid for a more attractive one. I am going to take another person's advice and bend the "locking" latch so that I don't have to lock it - just lift up and slide/swing. I also wish it had end caps for the top slide rail to make it a bit more attractive. A good deal!
customer_reviews.author: Dy

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and Doesn't Damage Walls, Banisters...
customer_reviews.text: We've purchased two of these, for different houses, and this is easily the best design for corralling kids, pets, etc., without damaging walls. Plus, this gate adapts well to diagonal openings at the top of stairs, between banisters, and more. Simply install the four eyelet screws and the installation is complete. This type doesn't press against the walls, like many others, so you don't damage your walls or loosen stair banisters. For a recent install, I purchased a universal mount on Amazon and attached the wood slat to the banister, then screwed the eyelets into the slat--the other side the eyelets screwed into door molding.
customer_reviews.author: Agent J

customer_reviews.title: A bit wobbly, but does the job
customer_reviews.text: It's not perfect. It's wood, so it gives. It comes in ONE color, but as you can see from my pic, it's easy to paint. I wouldn't trust it to stop a 40lb dog or toddler charging at it, but for a porch gate or kitchen gate, it's ideal. Took 3 minutes to install (I predrilled to make it a bit easier). Use long screws on the "hinge" side that you don't intend to disconnect, and leave them sticking out a bit, so it will lay flatter against the door jamb while still being readily available.
customer_reviews.author: C. Jolliff

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for many large area usage and very convenient!
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for a large entry area from our master bath to the bedroom. It was one on just a couple choices available for our 47” area. It’s super easy to install. It’s easy to open with one hand and when opened, it doesn’t disrupt traffic or get in the way. I originally purchased one that I thought had a more attractive appearance, but the inconvenience wasn’t worth it. Since this one can be easily removed or folded to the side, the appearance, (although not unattractive) isn’t an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for what I needed. I have 2 small pups that love to run downstairs out the dog door when it's bath time. I love this thing! it's out of the way when I don't need it (swung back against the wall) but I can close it in a jiffy to keep them in. Not the prettiest thing I admit, but it sure beats struggling with the old baby gate I had. It's really easy to install, but like another reviewer said, make sure you install it a little higher to clear the floor.
customer_reviews.author: CSgal

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gate for puppy...
customer_reviews.text: I got this gate so I could have my door open & my puppy couldn't get outside. This is the best baby/puppy gate I've ever used & definitely worth the money. Everyone that sees it & uses it really like it. I like that it's expandable & easy to use as it attaches to the door molding with small eye hooks. Very easy to put up or take down. And it opens & closes from either end. I use it like a "pet door". Ended up getting a 2nd one for my hallway inside the house. I highly recommend this gate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The current design is a bit cumbersome and best for applications where you don't need to open/close often
customer_reviews.text: It would be a solid 5 if they improved how the gate is secured to the walls. The current design is a bit cumbersome and best for applications where you don't need to open/close often. I modified mine to use carabiners. Other than that, this product does the job at a very competitive price. If you have the money, you should get something easier to use. Pros: - Doesn't make your doorway narrow because the whole thing swings open. - Easy to stow away when you want to keep it open. - Works across wider openings. - Easy to modify since it's wood. Cons: - A bit cumbersome for regular use.
customer_reviews.author: KennyG

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and put up
customer_reviews.text: If you have a wider span this gate is awesome. It doesn’t though withstand a dog that’s crazy with fear from thunder and lightening. This is the second one we purchased. We left the house for the day not realizing they were calling for thunderstorms. We have a malamute and an Australian Shepherd and it works wonderfully for keeping them out of the living room.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie  Hebrard

customer_reviews.title: I really like this gate and it's very convenient
customer_reviews.text: I really like this gate and it's very convenient, but one of the ends broke off before I could even get the gate installed. I don't know if it came damaged in the mail or if it happened after I got it out of the package. I used wood glue on it, so we'll see. I do like how it unlatches for easy access into the room it's blocking off.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle J.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect DOG gate!!
customer_reviews.text: This sucker has been awesome as a dog gate! We don't even have to hook it, just pull it across our hall area, and the dogs know that it is their zone. It does hook onto the eye, making it sturdier for the visiting pooch that tests the boundary. Minimal hardware attached everywhere and can be completely disconnected and taken down if need be. Can be mounted to open several ways and is perfect for wider areas to block off in a nice looking way. Folds back flat against the wall easily when not in use, as well. And.... drumroll.... it's not cheap looking plastic crap! The wood looks nice!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Great and Multifunctional
customer_reviews.text: We got this gate to contain our new puppy when she was out of her crate. It’s worked wonderfully. Installation was simple. The hooks to the wall aren’t the sturdiest ever, but they will do fine. I wouldn’t trust them against a huge dog or a determined child. As a barrier though they are fine. I really like that the gate lets me close off either the office or this entire end of the house without any real effort. It’s also silent, so it doesn’t wake my infant when someone needs into the back of the house. I have limited mobility in my hands as well, yet I can lift and hook this gate easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Harrell

customer_reviews.title: Low Profile Gate Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: Omg why didn’t I install this year’s ago? We have been using a crappy prop-up gate for YEARS...Why? I ask myself. This was super easy to install and just what we needed to keep the dogs out of certain rooms. They have a clean low profile and depending on install can be swung back completely away from the door. Only complaint is that one came with the plastic top rail cracked on the end (corner of package with no padding.) Too much bother to return and we need the gate now, so going to go with it. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L. Black

customer_reviews.title: Game changing gate!
customer_reviews.text: Game changing gate! I use these at the top and bottom of my stairs to kennel my dogs in that area. I have been through two other sets of gates and these work best. They scrunch up tightly and can swing open from EITHER side. We followed the instructions for dry wall and used the longer Screws, but unless you hit a stud, the screw won't hold tight. We used wall anchors and everything is secure. I had some leftover stain from a fence project so I used it on the gates and they look beautiful. Highly recommend, an incredible value for the price point!
customer_reviews.author: My Prerogative

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, easy to install, sturdy (but a little tricky to open and close)
customer_reviews.text: We originally ordered a metal gate with the ubiquitous pressure mounts that (in theory) hold it in place in the doorway. That gate, while more attractive than the Evenflo gate, would not stay up. We like that the Evenflo gate can be quickly mounted in a doorway with a solid wood frame with screws. Our 60-lb dog has never even attempted to take it down. The only (slight) negative is that going in and out is tricky--you must carefully align two metal pins into the eye bolts, and unlocking it requires two hands. However, overall, we are quite pleased. If we ever feel like it, we can stain or paint the wood for a more finished look.
customer_reviews.author: cateintn

customer_reviews.title: Good Gate But Watch Out For Possible Entrapment
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to be able to confine our puppy to one room when we're away. This was only option I have found for the wide opening it is being used on. Works great but, WARNING!!!, if your dog is a small breed like ours, and you're extending this gate out close to maximum length, the openings become large enough for puppy to get head through. The only way I could make this safe was to get creative with some wooden dowels and eye screws to prevent her getting her head through.
customer_reviews.author: don s

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the quality and price. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: With 3 large doggos this is a perfect gate to partition the kitchen from the living room. It prevents them from begging while we are cooking and eating. The gate hinges fastens permanently to the wall and swings/extends to hook into the eyelets on the opposite wall. The only thing we needed to do was buy bigger eyelet screws. I wouldn’t suggest this gate for determined pups who tend to jump or wiggle through small spaces as they could get hung up on the gate and hurt themselves. Another downside is that it fixes permanently to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla M. Wright

customer_reviews.title: One heck of a sturdy fence
customer_reviews.text: My twins hung on this fence when they were 18 months old quite a few times before I got them to quit and it held together through that!! I actually did rebuy the fence bc my dog decided to chew it up but that's no fault of Evenflo. It took several weeks of him chewing at night before a piece of wood came off. It fits our kitchen opening that is 63", I couldn't find anything else that would work so I'm happy that it's so well made
customer_reviews.author: Shelley_

customer_reviews.title: Broke easily
customer_reviews.text: Received with plastic top piece broken. We were in such desperate need of this gate we installed it anyways. Use ig at the bottom of staircase to keep our dogs in the basement. Works well easy to lock and unlock. Fits across wide or odd spaces. If ur dog jumps up on the gate I'm not sure it would hold for long, flimsy and weak but serves its purpose. Diamond shaped hole are too small for a cat to get through.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered three of these and so glad they worked perfectly. I watch my one year old granddaughter and she is very busy. I had to section off a room with openings over 40”. A pressure gate would not have worked for me with such a large opening and the nicest thing is I just open the gates when she’s not here. No hassle. They look very nice and are so easy to use. My husband had them installed in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: C. Souders

customer_reviews.title: Good for small dogs
customer_reviews.text: We use this at the bottom of our stairs to keep the dogs from going up into our bedrooms unsupervised. It works fine for us since we have small-ish dogs. None weigh more than 25 pounds. The gate is a bit wiggly when opening and closing it. I can imagine that a German Shepherd or similar could break this gate. But we are using it as a temporary fix until our puppy is house trained. :)
customer_reviews.author: book loving mom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Finally! A gate that gets out of the way when not in use! I will say I am not using this for a child, but for 3 small chihuahuas. This is more of a visual barrier, however it does also provide physical restraint also. Super easy to install at the top of my basement stairs, though like I said, it may not work well for children or bigger dogs. I love love love that not only does it expand and contract, but it also swings FLAT against the wall when not needed. I never realized how hard that was to find!

customer_reviews.title: First, this doesn't 'Swing'. If you try to ...
customer_reviews.text: First, this doesn't 'Swing'. If you try to swing it, it will bend the little pieces used to hook it to the walls. Second, my 2yr old figured out on his own how to get it open within minutes of it being mounted. Third, The latch system could be improved greatly as someone else said.
customer_reviews.author: A daley

customer_reviews.title: So easy to install
customer_reviews.text: We love the gate. It is so EASY to install and it does not matter which side of the wall or the direction you want it to swing. It works every way!! We have two. We have even easily unhooked it and taken it with us to our daughters house and use it on our deck so we don't have to buy a third one. We use it for our puppy and it works for our neighbors adult dog who comes to visit too.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy enough
customer_reviews.text: Yes there are plastic and metal gates available and I felt environmentally conscious and paid premium price for wooden gate. I like the gate and it looks exactly like in product pictures. Comes with additional screws and everything. I am cutting off one star as the hooks which attach to the screw loop are a little weak and bend. I really wish they product team would have put more thought into it. I also did not like the plastic cover on to of the gate :( . They might have used some sustainable material such as bamboo.
customer_reviews.author: Abtpd_Nryn

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, looks good.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this divider to keep the dogs out of the living room. It works better than anything else in my opinion. One of the dogs learned to open it by pushing it up and sliding it left because the latch is made of a softer metal and it eventually bends enough to allow the hook to slide out of the loop. Or maybe my dog is just too smart... still, it looks nice and does it's job in most cases.
customer_reviews.author: Alight Images

customer_reviews.title: One of the best parenting purchases ever
customer_reviews.text: Truly this gate has been a game changer for us. We installed it at the bottom of the stairs and also put additional eye-anchors (or whatever they are called) in two large doorways. We can now choose to effortlessly trap our daughters in two different rooms in addition to just keeping them from climbing the stairs. This was so easy to install and has so greatly improved our peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... 10 minutes to install and I am not that great at measuring things correctly
customer_reviews.text: This literally took 10 minutes to install and I am not that great at measuring things correctly. This gate is being used on a deck to keep my 21 month old safe and so far it works perfect. Not sure how it will survive the weather into the winter but it was so inexpensive if I had to buy it again it wouldn't be a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Lyons

customer_reviews.title: area denial
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for sealing off a little nook in the living room. Our 15 month old twins have shown no interest in climbing it (despite climbing just about everything else they encounter). This product wouldn't be my first choice for use as a gate that sees much use, but it makes a very fine semi-permanent fence. As some others have mentioned make sure you read the directions closely, and if you have baseboard trim you may also be better off just marking your holes with the fence extended in place rather than relying on a tape measure.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for two reasons, I have four dogs and I recently got custody of my niece-5 and nephew-9. I bought this to put at the top of my stairs to confine the dogs to one area and to keep the kids from falling down the stairs at night or playing on them. The lock mechanism is easy enough for them to use but secure. The dogs cant push it down like they do with the others. I am planning to get another one for a different area of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Quin

customer_reviews.title: I love this gate
customer_reviews.text: I love this gate. We have chihuahua's and I keep them in the kitchen during the day. It works great. I really like that you can pull it out to a larger or smaller opening because we have a wide entrance into the kitchen. We had one before but it did not have the guard on top and the wooden strips began to break after time. the guard wih protect the wooden strips so that nothing can get caught on them and cause them to break. Another good thing is that it can easily been taken down it has latches on both sides.
customer_reviews.author: pjcauthen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.  Exactly what I needed for the doggies.
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for this exact product for years with no luck. This one is designed perfectly. Installed in minutes, easy to use, does the job without adding any unnecessary obstacles to clutter my daily routines. What they don't say, is that once installed, it easily functions as a swing door, making things soooo much easier. I'm ordering another one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Recommend
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this gate for the family lake house, in order to keep the dogs from roaming without supervision. This gate allows you to move it completely out of the way when not in use (which is why I purchased it) and also doesn't run across the bottom of the floor like most gates, forcing you to step over a piece when walking through. The gate was so simple and easy to put up. I am thinking about buying another one of these for my home.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Barrier
customer_reviews.text: We had problems with the dogs scratching at the door leading to the garage after we left the house. This gate was a great solution to preventing them access to the hallway leading to the door. It does the job however, I believe that if the dogs realized they could break through the panel with their weight (60lbs), it would not be of great use. As long as they stay stupid, it makes a fantastic barrier.
customer_reviews.author: Debt1

customer_reviews.title: Nice gates, easy to install and pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep our two dogs from trashing the house when we are not home. Bought two and they are very easy to install- much easier than the metal gate. They are sturdy and high enough to keep both the poodle and the pitbull contained. Since they are mounted on just 4 screw eyes, they may not last all that long but I'm happy with them so far.
customer_reviews.author: R. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, best for doorway
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. So easy to install. Also like that you can swing the gate when open to a side angle so you have more space to spep through entry. Note...If have a small puppy you will need to get some cheap screen or fencing because they can poke hesd through but not easy to pull back out. I wanted to order more of these but Amazon had a limit on 2?? Weird!
customer_reviews.author: Louiethepup

customer_reviews.title: Good expanding fence if you need it as a light weight barrier
customer_reviews.text: This expanding fence is what is was looking for. The first one arrived broken. The box looked fine, but some of the end slates were snapped and broken in places. Amazon was great and arranged for UPS to pick up the damaged product from my house the next day. The new one arrived 2 days later and was in good shape. The wood slates are a little thin so a dog running at full speed would probably break it, but for our smaller dog, it does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: pennyj26

customer_reviews.title: flimsy and don't even stay together so weak the latches ...
customer_reviews.text: flimsy and don't even stay together so weak the latches i even brought new screws but still falls apart its cheap , and flimsy if you were trying to ' jetti mind trick ' someone then it may work, otherwise spend extra and get a real gate
customer_reviews.author: trixie doodle

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile and easy to use. Long enough to fit other places that need to be blocked off.
customer_reviews.text: I am really pleased with this divider. I use it block off doorways, hallways, or even places in our living room between the wall and couches. It comes with screws to hook the gate more securely but they aren't really needed. I use a chair or a heavy box to make sure the gate doesn't fall over or my puppy from pushing it over. Really pleased with this product and with Amazon sending a new one in free of charge because the first one was delivered all broken up due to Ontrac shpping.
customer_reviews.author: B. M. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Easy to install, like, minutes, easy to use, easy to remove. A must have if you have a small dog that you want to temporarily block from entering an area. We purchased one for our home, the opening is the size of gate fully extended, no issues with opening or closing. We purchased two more for someone that has a much larger entrance, they can pull and attach together to make one large gate. So far they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safety Gate that works
customer_reviews.text: This gate has been a real godsend. Our hallway is 4 feet across and finding a gate that is stable at a price that was affordable was nearly impossible until we found this one. Keeps my great grandson safe and out of areas he shouldn't be. Only one thing I wish were different, and that larger eye-hooks. This would make opening and closing the gate in a hurry much easier. But that's an easy fix.
customer_reviews.author: Susan G.

customer_reviews.title: simple solution
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly for our needs. We used it to block off the end of a hallway where our cat's food and water is so that the dog can't get to it. We installed it about 10 inches off the floor so the cat can go under it but it still blocks the dog. i also put one of the extra eye hooks into the wall so that when we have the gate open we can hook it in and it stays flat against the wall instead of swinging out on it's own
customer_reviews.author: E. Smoger

customer_reviews.title: Easy to open and install! Stays put
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed, this is the easiest to use dog gate ever!! And we have had maaaaaany. The installation was a breeze and I love the way it mounts to the wall, slides open or swings out - and easy to swing away when not in use. (followed another user’s comment about adding a ring to hook it to the wall after swinging it out of the way when not in use). Love it! Tall, sturdy, so easy to open and close.
customer_reviews.author: Kari JoTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Quality product. Super easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I bought an "open box" priced at almost half the cost. Well worth it since it was like new as described. If you can use a level, screw in a couple of eyelets, you can install this gate in 5 minutes. Gate mechanism operates smoothly very will. Good fit and finish and look great. It will also fold against a wall with no problem. I highly recommended this product.
customer_reviews.author: BobS

customer_reviews.title: Decent expandable gate
customer_reviews.text: So far this gate is working ok, it's a little awkward in opening, but I think from reviews, that is the nature of these kinds of gates. Only had it a few weeks. The closing latch is hard with one hand, again, I think many other gates have this problem, but, I think partly it's to make it difficult for children to open for safety reasons
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase for my havanese puppy!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase ever! Bought this to block my puppy from running into the living room area and separate him from my guinea pigs. It is easy to install. Do note to measure one side first and drill a hole before installing the hook. Do not wing it lol. You can put it off the ground as well. It is a must have to control your puppy's environment.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Chan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for keeping the dogs downstairs!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because my dogs kept getting in bed during the day. If I can't lay in bed all day, they can't either! I wanted something that I could nudge open or shut as I ran up or down the stairs--something that wouldn't slow down my passage, and this gate hasn't let me down. At first my husband installed it too low, so it dragged on the ground, but once he raised it up a bit higher, it was VERY user friendly. All that for a reasonable price makes this gate a total win.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: works perfect to keep our puppy out of the basement (which ...
customer_reviews.text: works perfect to keep our puppy out of the basement (which is a big accident area for us) but still allows my children to easily go up & down from that level. Comes with 4 long & 4 short screws to mounting depending on what type of material it will be mounted to which is great! Easy instructions. Super happy with this purchase & would buy it again for sure! It seems pretty durable too so I'm sure it won't need to be replaced.We've used this for about month now.
customer_reviews.author: Pitty Mama

customer_reviews.title: Height adjusts up and down depending on how wide the gate is open; needs mounting hardware installed in the door frame
customer_reviews.text: The narrower the gate is, the taller it is and the wider you open it, the shorter it gets. I don't like the fact that I have to attach hardware to my door frame to make full use of this gate. It also broke after a short time. It might be because we didn't hang it in the door frame, but the gate opened beyond it's limit and the top cracked and the pieces came apart. The wood at the bottom also broke, which would not be safe for a child. (We got it for a dog.)
customer_reviews.author: Amy Blodgett

customer_reviews.title: Great product for angled areas!
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I bought this despite some reviews saying it was more of a "visual barrier" than a physical one. I had one of these as a kid and it was much more flimsy than the one I just bought. The wood is solid, and the plastic cover on top makes it very easy to slide. I bought this as a solution on an angled doorway that I had to install hooks on a corner with angle. Very happy with this purchase to keep dogs out of basement and confined to kitchen. I defiately recommend for any tricky install angle. And installing was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Emily A.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and was easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I bought the gate to keep my elderly dog from climbing the stairs. I improved the looks of it by sanding off the black warning labels printed on the wood (it is a the bottom of the stairs not the top and there are no children in the house). I stained it with Watco Danish Oil Golden Oak. Looks great and was easy to install. It is nice clear wood that took the oil finish very well.
customer_reviews.author: Christine H.

customer_reviews.title: Good gate
customer_reviews.text: This is my third gate of this type. They are the only gate wide enough for the door between my kitchen and living room. It fits the opening and fold (mostly) out of the way when not in use. It keeps dogs and baby out of the kitchen and handles what the baby throws at it. My last one was chewed apart by our beagle though so if you are buying this for a dog be aware that they can chew and ingest the wood.
customer_reviews.author: hooked

customer_reviews.title: No match for our wiener dog
customer_reviews.text: The red stuff on the gate is cyan pepper. We were trying to dissuade him from chewing it with cyan pepper and giving him plenty of chew toys, but it didn't work. Other than trying to keep a dog confined to areas of your house while you're away, I think the gate is fine for most uses.
customer_reviews.author: QQ

customer_reviews.title: It’s a decent gate
customer_reviews.text: I love this gate! I’ve bought two! It’s not the most sturdy gate in the world (hence why I’ve bought two). Definitely wouldn’t recommend putting it in-front of stairs because the latches easily bend. But it works perfectly blocking off my kitchen from my living room. It’s held up to a 3 yr old and 5 dogs fairly well considering! The latches will bend, but they bend back and continue working for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Evenflo Expandible Gate used to keep cats out
customer_reviews.text: I use these to keep my cats from entering rooms. I took off the plastic peace leaving a zig-zag pattern on the top. This keeps the cats from jumping or climbing over. It is working very well.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Cozy Mystery Reader

customer_reviews.title: Best gate! Buy it now!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these gates! This was such a perfect perchase and fit two different doorways. We have two entrances to the living room that we need blocked at night, we have a senior dog who sometimes has accidents and it’s easier if she didn’t in the living room. The one entrance to our living room is pretty wide and we were having trouble finding a dog gate long enough that wasn’t ridiculously expensive. I ordered 2 of these on a whim and am so happy I did. We are moving soon and will be taking these with us as well as possibly purchasing more.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Not good for climbers
customer_reviews.text: I put this as a barricade so my dog wouldn’t use my deck for his bathroom. It installed great, a little flimsy, but did great for the first couple of days. Then the dog figured out how to climb over. He puts his front paws on the top and hind paws in the grooves of the gate, therefore hoisting himself over the gate and onto the deck. My advice- if you have a climber (child or animal) they will eventually figure it out, don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: M. Finch

customer_reviews.title: Good product for wide doorways
customer_reviews.text: Used for 1 year and counting, fits well in our extra wide doorway but is almost too tall for me to hop over easily. This doesn’t seem to be built to swing open/shut but it slides well. Not sure I’d trust it at the top of stairs as it’s just a flimsy piece of metal clipped into 4 small eye hooks that are screwed into the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Gaynor

customer_reviews.title: Gate Works Great On My Deck to Keep Dog Off
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to put at the top of my steps to my deck. I have a Great Pyrenees from coming on the deck and getting it dirty. It has worked well. Sherman now barks when he is ready to come in and I can check his paws to hose off if needed. So far it has held up well and does exactly what I needed it for. It was easy to install. There is only four eyehooks to screw into the wood. I would recommend this gate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best pet gates Easy , portable and great height for labs
customer_reviews.text: I love these gates for my dogs. They're easily set. Super expandable virtually with one hand and very sturdy and I don't even use the mounting hardware. They have a base track that the expansion slides over so it's neat and troublefree. I have 2 of them and they kept my dogs safe from my kitchen remodel and a slew of contractors coming and going Also nice height -My dogs are labs. I've tried so many gates and these are the best by far for dogs anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Easily breakable but work well for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two for our home when our daughter started crawling. They work well enough. Definitely decent for the price. One has broken already though. Internal parts on the top and bottom are made of plastic, so if things bend at all the wood catches the plastic inside and can snap it. Be careful with them and you'll be fine. We had draped a blanket over the one that broke and I think the extra weight was what ruined it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: EASY to use, easy to install!  Just 4 screw holes!
customer_reviews.text: Really works easy and would be perfect for keeping a baby or small dog in check. However, it didn't work to stop my Rat Terrier from bouncing all over the garage door and getting it dirty when we're gone. :( No fault of the divider gate. He just bounced on it and got mud on it AND the door! The gate itself, though, works nice. Would recommend it for blocking a baby or a small dog.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Gramma

customer_reviews.title: Tall and narrow
customer_reviews.text: I really like this because it is one of the few gates that fit in tiny, narrow doorways. And the swinging action makes it really convienent. However, it is a lot taller than other gates. You have to swing it open, can't step over it. And our cat can't jump over it, which defeats my purpose in buying it, which was to protect the litter box. But I've kept using it anyway, because I do really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Great heavy duty gate
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a gate that would fold out of the way and this ones does. I put it at the bottom of my stair case so my three large dogs would not go upstairs anymore and works great. It pushes out of the way and allows me to come downstairs with my hands full and little effort to move the gate. Its solid wood so you could paint or stain the wood and top rail is a heavy plastic which could also be painted or stained. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great to keep new puppy contained.
customer_reviews.text: After reading another review that this scratched up someone's wooden floor when following measurment instructions, I chose to do my own measurements on the height and made sure to secure into available wall studs on each side. Works great and our wood floor is fine. Daughter's new puppy isn't happy with it, but we all love it!
customer_reviews.author: Sola Scriptura

customer_reviews.title: Read the description before getting. Unlike me. Lol
customer_reviews.text: I must not have read the description well enough because i Didn’t realize it won’t collapse small. The smallest it collapses is almost the size of our doorway... but we are using it leaning up against the doorway for now. It’s a nice gate if you don’t need it to get super small.
customer_reviews.author: Goldie Locks 5Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to keep my dogs out of my front room so they wouldn't run out the front door every time we opened it. It's worked perfectly. No more issues when someone rings the doorbell or one of us is trying to go in and out the door. I do have small dogs, a Yorkie mix and a Jack Russell mix. I wouldn't think it would work very well for larger dogs but for them it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy4My4

customer_reviews.title: Gate
customer_reviews.text: This I used on stairs and it isn’t the best for that. Opening and closing is a little hard because of the circle hooks with the latch. I have one latch that is loose so now I will get the whole gate to come off when it is opened. It does it job keeping pets and kids from going into areas not wanted.
customer_reviews.author: JASB

customer_reviews.title: great quality inexpensive option that screws in to the wall.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install by hand screwing in hooks in to wooden door frame. Perfect for stairs, opens accordion style or can swing open. I bought 2 for the top and bottom of the stairs to keep my baby safe. I have a tension gate but didnt feel that was secure enough for stairs. The bottom of my staircase only has one wall so I screwed one side in to a wooden dresser that the tv sits on. It's almost 50 inches between the 2.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Gorman

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this gate! It's so versatile and convenient. I've been using 1 for a little over a month now. I just returned 2 other "regular" gates and bought 2 more of these. We keep our puppy gated in the dining room and these are so much easier to allow kids and short people (like my 6 year old grandson and me!) to walk through. Winner!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these to be able to block off our kitchen from our dogs. Since they tend to want to be near my feet while I'm cooking and things can drop or I've almost tripped over them. This was for their safety and mine. Easy to install very secure for my three small dogs to stay out. My dogs do not push on it so I don't know if a big dog would be able to damage them or not.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny M

customer_reviews.title: perfect for the wide doorway
customer_reviews.text: we got very tired of moving the tension mount gate we were using to keep our furbabies out of the living area when we weren't around to watch them. After taking it down we always had to find a place to put it in our small space. This gate is mounted to frame and swings out of the way when we need it open. It's not the prettiest thing in the room but it works....
customer_reviews.author: Gaby

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and completely effective
customer_reviews.text: Love this product!We got a new puppy that wanted to eat our other dogs' food. So we feed her in the kitchen with the Evenflo room divider in place. Then open it up once the other dogs are finished. She can see out, so she doesn't feel completely isolated. It is super easy to install, just 4 screw eyes into the wooden doorway (poke a starter hole with a hammer and nail or awl to make it easier}. We also have used it to keep everyone out of the kitchen when working on appliances.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Church

customer_reviews.title: This was very easy to install on our deck
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to install on our deck. We us it for outdoors and does not work as well when its wet but we use it more when its nice outside and we are on the deck. I love the top plastic rail so that i don't pinch my fingers in it. The latch is simple and can easily be opened by a toddler so watch them around it. We use it for puppys and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L

customer_reviews.title: Extremely pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.text: We are extremely happy with this gate for our 30 pound puppy. The gate is sturdy (even when our puppy puts his front paws on it), and it is very easy to use. We needed something that would expand and be tall enough for when our dog got bigger. We would definitely recommend this to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: jelledge

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I personally love this, keeps my baby in and my dog out and I don't have to fight with the compression gates. Perfect for an odd sized doorway or long hallway, even a weird corner to corner thing would be possible with this. My husband isn't a fan though, he would prefer something that actually can just be shut and latches easily, he doesn't like having to line up the bottom and top holes to get it to latch and not be floppy. I don't see this as a problem so it really just depends on your preference.
customer_reviews.author: O'Doherty FamilyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: This gate is awesome. It is surprisingly sturdy and very easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: This gate is awesome. It is surprisingly sturdy and very easy to use. Installation simply involves installing four eye hooks which makes it a breeze to use as a sturdy gate. The gate extends with just enough tension to hold itself up though, so we didn't even have to install the eyehooks at first to keep our busy dog away from the front door. The height is perfect, and it has a nice coloring to it. By far, it is one of the better gates that we have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Amybriana

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Expansion gate
customer_reviews.text: This expansion gate is sturdy and easy to install. We bought 2 of them, the first to separate our 2 dogs when they eat. The second one is to keep the little dog on the porch when we sit outside. They easily expand to accommodate different widths so they were exactly what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy easy gate
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, love that it swings out, easy to latch and unlatch. I bought this after returning a retractable gate that was harder than it looked to use. So glad I purchased this. Keeps our puppy off the stairs and our cats easy jump over it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great gate for large space (from porch)
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this on my front porch as a deterrent to keep my curious toddler away from the steps. For the most part she leaves the gate alone,but because it’s extended to full capacity, she can shake it rather well. Adults have a hard time unlatching it but once you have used it, it’s easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: K Wells

customer_reviews.title: Didn't seem as sturdy as I thought. Would not use if for stairs or barrier.
customer_reviews.text: Like: Easy to install Didn't like: My adult son fell against the gate breaking half of it off. This happened after one week and threw the gate away and made a nice wooden one by myself. The gate kept on coming undone from the end that was "supposed" to be secure on both sides for the swing effect. My son hit against it running upstairs and it stayed hooked but crashed flat and broke beyond repair. If a toddler charged the gate going the other way he could possible have crashed through and fell down the stairs. Fortunately we just use it for small pets. I should have asked for my money back, but I already trashed it.
customer_reviews.author: S.S.

customer_reviews.title: Pets on deck problem solved
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these for our large deck. We wanted to keep our dogs on the deck but it had 2 openings. Do we have swinging gates made? No! These are perfect. they attach as simply as they say they will and easily swing open either way and either side. At the end of the day to get them out of poor weather or when we dont' want them up they come off super easy and are slim, lightweight and easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Bee Gee

product_meta.title: Evenflo Expansion Walk Thru Room Divider Gate
product_meta.description: The Expansion Swing Wide gate helps parents keep their children safe from household dangers This gate can be used in a variety of openings because it is extra wide, but still has the ability to retract as its opens. Its four point hardware mounting is easy to install and because the gate swings in either direction, it is convenient for high traffic areas allowing for quick and easy pass through. The plastic telescoping safety rail also will keep fingers safe from pinching.
feature_bullets: Extra-Wide Width: Fits a Broad Range of Openings 24"-60" (71cm - 152cm) 32" (81cm) Tall. a Must-Have for Great Rooms or Open Floor Plans
Hardware Mount: For Extra Safety, Installs in Minutes. Materials Made With Plastic & Wood
One Hand Latch: is Easy to Operate. the Telescoping Safety Rail Keeps Fingers Safe From Pinching During Use
Great for Children and Pets: Maintain a Safe Home Environment for Children and Pets
Convenient for High Traffic Areas Allowing for Quick and Easy Pass Through
Four point hardware mounting makes installation a cinch
Telescoping safety rail: prevents pinching. For 6 to 12 Months
Gate Swings Open: in both directions and can be opened on either side
Gate freely retracts: allows for easy maneuverability in tight spaces

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,103 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
